component — List and Vector Components¶

Components include the Vector class, Position class, and various other compatibility classes to work with OpenGL.

Vector operations¶

class component.Vector(num_list)¶

Creates a collection of n numbers that represent a position in n-space.

dot(other)¶

Returns the dot product of two vectors.

If the two vectors are not in the same space, raises an InvalidComparisonException.

cross(other)¶

Returns the cross product of two vectors.

If the two vectors are not in the same space, raises an InvalidComparisonException.

rot(angle)¶

Rotates the current Vector about the z-axis.

mag()¶

Retuns the magnitude of the Vector.

normalize()¶

Returns a Vector of magnitude 1 with the same direction.

project(axis)¶

Returns a 1D projection of the Vector onto axis.

isParallel(vector)¶

Returns True if the two vectors have the same direction.

static zero()¶

Returns the zero vector in 3-space.

class component.Pair(Vector)¶

Creates a Vector in 2-space. Pair extends all the methods from Vector, but will only operate against other Pairs. Any other comparison will throw a TypeError exception.

class component.Position(Pair)¶

Creates a Pair that represents an object’s position in a space.

Position will operate against other Position objects as well as Velocity objects.

class component.Velocity(Pair)¶

Creates a Pair that represents the rate of movement in a space with respect to time.

To prevent redundancy, Velocity objects also represent acceleration.

Velocity will operate on objects of the same type. Comparing against other types will throw a TypeError exception.
